my:Details.my:Title: Ship to Ship Operation (mother ship anchored)

my:Hazard.my:Description: Lack of and / or improper communication
Structural damage to ship’s hull (mooring/unmooring to/from the other ship)
Structural damage to ship’s hull, bridge wings, cargo cranes, etc. during cargo operation

my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Ballast operation on both ships to be agreed and monitored to avoid any damage to any of the ships or cargo caused by overflowing ballast tanks; b) Pay attention to any maintenance or repairs activities carried out in the area which could be affected by ballast water overflow.
Refer to 'Mooring/Unmooring Operation (incl. Shifting the Vessel Using Ship’s Ropes)' risk assessment.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Hazards associated strictly with cargo operation
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: Refer to 'Cargo Loading/Discharging Operation' and/or 'Loading/Discharging Dusty Cargo' risk assessments as applicable.

my:Main.my:Footer: Risk Assessment: D 22 - Ship to Ship Operation (mother ship anchored)
